name: Homewood Suites Seattle Convention Center Pike Street

reviews.text: I stayed here for one night on November 20th, with a friend. I was visiting from Scotland and we wanted to have a night downtown. I work as a Front Office Manager in the hotel industry and have previously worked for a Hilton property so I have high standards when staying in hotels. But I am pleased to say that my expectations were not only met, but exceeded!
reviews.title: First Class Customer Service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The young lady who greeted us at check in was so friendly and helpful and both me and my friend were delighted to hear we had been upgraded to a suite. Our room was clean, beautiful and spacious. I was even more impressed when we received a call from the front desk to check we were pleased with our room. And then upon our departure to do some sightseeing, the front desk agent greeted us by name. This is something I love and expect my team to do so it is wonderful to see it in practice in other hotels.
reviews.title: Can I live here? WOW!

reviews.text: Our service the following morning was again excellent. The young lady on the desk, who's name I did not get but who is moving to England soon, was a credit to the hotel. She was friendly and helpful and answered all of our questions perfectly. She even allowed us to park for an extra 2 hours after check out for free.
reviews.title: A Gem of a Place on the Edge of Seattle's Downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I was so pleased with the outstanding customer service we received. I will definitely recommend this hotel to friends.
reviews.title: REDEMPTION

reviews.text: We bid for this room and thought that even if it was a dump, it would suffice for a single night. We were pleasantly surprised! When I first checked in, the front desk clerk (Ashleigh) was sunshine and professionalism. I asked for two beds, which weren't available (it's becoming a pattern with "bid" rooms). I let her know that we were there for the marathon and one of us *cough* snores. She said they weren't completely full, and that she could upgrade me to a suite with a pull-out couch. Worth whatever upcharge there was going to be. None? Did I hear that right? She said that since they weren't full, she wanted to make sure I enjoyed my stay.
reviews.title: Tall showers

reviews.text: As a person that lives out of Homewood suites hotels from coast to coast year round I can compare them well. This is one of the best I've stayed at.
reviews.title: A review from your extended stay business traveler

reviews.text: 1. The best catored Homewood suites ever! The food quality varies considerably often towards the lower end at Homewood suites everywhere. Well you can forget about the nacho night with dry chips in a basket and a cheese dispenser, this hotel had some of the best food choices for the evening meals I have ever seen! Sure it's not filet mignon but how about stuffed Salmon? YEAH! Great evening eats, very friendly and helpful "hosts". Nicely done!
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Friendly staff, May considering avoiding the holidays

reviews.text: 2. Rooms: Sure most Homewoods are a two room type layout. But the size, appointments and layout make you feel like you are living in a small apartment at this hotel. Very nice!
reviews.title: worth extra walk

reviews.text: 3. Location. So many walkable options for dining and more park the car and hoof it!
reviews.title: Good if you get a quiet room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Top notch Homewood. Keep those evening meals up guys!
reviews.title: Stay at your own risk.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel gets it. The minor details are what set this hotel apart from the others. Ashley at the front desk was extremely sweet and accommodating, checking me in well before the 3pm check in time after a horribly delayed red eye flight from the right coast.
reviews.title: Want to go back

reviews.text: The rooms are immaculate. Clean, nice furniture, and are fully stocked.
reviews.title: Plenty of space to spread out--right downtown.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Small things like the basket full of umbrellas at the entryway really set this hotel apart. Yes, we all know it rains in Seattle, but how many of us pack umbrellas on our trips? Probably not many.
reviews.title: Fantastic operation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is definitely in walking distance to the Space Needle/Pike Market and Westlake.
reviews.title: nice hotel

reviews.text: This all-suite hotel is great for taking care of business in downtown Seattle. It's just upstream from the Wash. state convention center on Pike Street--straddling two neighborhoods: downtown and Capitol Hill.
reviews.title: Very helpfu staff, great lite meals and convenient

reviews.text: From the moment we entered the hotel, the staff was hands down very professional, friendly and gave exceptional customer service.
reviews.title: The Best Hotel in Seattle

reviews.text: My stay at the Homewood Suites on Pike was very enjoyable. I was there for six nights. While we had a room street side (on Pike) we did not find the traffic noise too unbearable. The suite was large and comfortable with a full fridge, microwave, two burners, sink, dishes, utensils and appliances. Ice machine location was quite inconvenient. Unfortunately the hotel allows smoking so either the smoke or the powerful chemical "cover-up" fragrance attacked you in the hallway. This is the reason I went 4 stars on cleanliness otherwise it was superb. The free breakfast (every day) and dinner (Mon to Thurs) with beer and wine was a pleasant extra. Local newspaper and free internet were appreciated. The staff were friendly and provided great service and advice. Flat rate by taxi from the airport to the hotel is $32 and once at the hotel they have a shuttle for various locations downtown. This location is ideal and we walked to the convention centre two blocks away, Key Arena, Pike Place Market, and around downtown. The spacious suite was comfortable for three of us with a separate bedroom with a king bed and a queen fold out couch in the living room. I highly recommend this hotel to you.
reviews.title: Excellent choice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our first night we stayed in a Streeet side room, we didn't get any sleep do to the traffic noise. My wife and I are both Hilton Hhonors Diamond, when we complained the manager said we should have put that we wanted a "Quiet" room in our profiles. If you stay here be sure to request a courtyard room. He did offer a quiet room on the couryard side of the hotel, we canceld the rest of our stay and just checked out. The windows all need replaced and let the noise in so at least if you stay in the courtyard side you won't hear the streat noise.
reviews.title: Sleeples in Seattle, windows don't close

reviews.text: Honestly, if I didnt have a job to go home to I could have easily moved into this place! Rooms were very spacious and spotless. The breakfast had plenty of choices, the staff were helpful and always had a smile when approached. The location is great for the convention centre and downtown shopping and its about a 15-20 minute walk to the Pike Market. I asked for a quiet room facing the inner courtyard and received just that so, no street noise whatsoever. The Welcome Home reception held on weekdays was such a great thing - it absolutely made my day after a long day at work and it really did feel like coming home.
reviews.title: Could have moved into Homewood Suites on Pike

reviews.text: We stayed here pre-cruise. Took Amtrak from Vancouver BC. We called ahead and the hotels free shuttle was there to pick us up. Check in/out was a breeze. Staff was great. Inclusive breakfast was fantastic, more than I expected. The only complaint was the coffee.. it could have removed paint. The free shuttle to some of the major city attractions was easy to book and we never had to wait long for it. Unfortunately no shuttle to the pier but the front desk called a taxi for us while we had breakfast. Our room was very clean. The beds were very comfortable....even the hide-a-bed. The hotel was busy as it was a big football weekend but was still quiet. Would definitely recommend it...in fact, I already have.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

aka: Homewood Suites Seattle Convention Center Pike Street Hotel Seattle
description: Located on the seam of downtown Seattle, just blocks from the celebrated Pike Place Market, Paramount Theatre, and the shopping district, our boutique style hotel has the ultimate Seattle location. Featuring 195 individually designed guestrooms and suites that are uniquely Seattle.
